text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with bharata rush Etta with grilled
figs now you know everything I make look
sexy but this is on a whole nother level
this is just truly truly beautiful food
and it starts with this burrata this is
a super creamy super rich super amazing
fresh mozzarella cheese type product
that you're going to have to go to one
of the fancy cheese shops to get and I
can't even really describe it because I
don't have what's called a large
collection of words you talk vocabulary
I don't have the vocabulary to describe
this properly but it is just beyond
description just impossibly soft creamy
rich it's unbelievable it's amazing so
find some here's the other star of the
show black mission figs the world's best
fig probably the sexiest fruit ever I
think we're all pretty much in agreement
there to prep the figs give them a rinse
and then cut them in half look how
beautiful that is alright so those are
ready for the grill I'm going to go out
to the grill we've already cooked our
main course let's say I don't know pork
chops alright the grill still hot we're
going to place the figs down skin side
down and here's the deal you got a
couple options here you can just grill
them this way just through the skin side
up all the way see that skin will
protect the fig from the fire or you can
after about two minutes turn them over
and get a little caramelization on the
cut side the trade off to get that extra
caramelize ation is yes they're going to
stick a little bit no way to avoid that
if you don't want them to stick just let
them go all the way on the skin side you
will actually see them kind of puff up
start to bubble they get all engorged
with deliciousness see that oh my god
unbelievable alright when you see the
little juices bubbling they're done so
it's up to you there's really no wrong
way to do them I kind of did half one
way half the other just to experiment
all delicious all right so our figs are
ready the last step we're going to grill
our bread over the coals now this is
highly dangerous it's not something you
want to walk away from all right so you
want to stand right there
want to keep them moving keep turning
them until you get a nice even toast on
both sides and it really is a huge
difference between doing it on the grill
and doing it into toaster you get that
nice smokiness really really beautiful
to assemble put a piece of warm toast
down top it with a big thick slice of
that creamy amazing burrata cheese put
your grilled figs around still warm from
the grill and then a balsamic
vinaigrette which is just half balsamic
vinegar a good aged 1/2 olive oil just
shake it in a bottle drizzle it over it
is just the perfect liaison between the
creamy cheese slightly tangy and that
sweet smoky fig perfect this is a savory
dish not a dessert so a little fresh
cracked black pepper you can't see it
too well here but I'm putting some nice
flaky sea salt all around this and on
top of the cheese and you're ready to
eat now you could go knife and fork on
this but I suggest you don't something
this sexy this sensual really needs to
be in with your hands so take a fig
smash it over the cheese pick it up and
bite and you are truly going to be
amazed at how incredible this is so
there you go brought a cheese bruschetta
with grilled figs a little balsamic
vinaigrette incredibly simple rustic and
just magical go find some FIGS go find
some burrata cheese you like I said
you've got to go to the expensive cheese
store but they have it call around all
the ingredients are on the site all
three of them I really hope you give it
a try well fresh figs are in season and
as always enjoy
